data: PLASURG Microvascular Surgery and Flaps - Post Operative (Multiphase)
Nurse to Initiate Surgeon Immediate Post Operative phase. These orders continue on the Inpatient Unit
Discontinue PLASURG Pre Operative (Day of Surgery) PowerPlan
Assess Flap Color, Assess Flap Turgor, Assess Flap Capillary Refill, Assess Doppler Signal, q1h, For 72 hour
T+3;N, Assess Flap Color, Assess Flap Turgor, Assess Flap Capillary Refill, Assess Doppler Signal, q2h, For 48 hour
T+5;N, Assess Flap Color, Assess Flap Turgor, Assess Flap Capillary Refill, Assess Doppler Signal, q4h, For 48 hour
T+7;N, Assess Flap Color, Assess Flap Turgor, Assess Flap Capillary Refill, Assess Doppler Signal, q6h, Until discharge
Check for constriction at pedicle location. Avoid tight dressings, splints, ties, external pressure over pedicle
Notify provider per order comments criteria
T+5;N, Flap dressing will be changed / removed on post-op day 5 by surgeon
Cleansing instructions: Clean all suture lines with normal saline BID and PRN
Empty, strip and record drainage q6h and PRN
Change Incision Site dressing post-op day 2 and PRN
Site: SKIN GRAFT Donor Site(s), Expose SKIN GRAFT DONOR site Xeroform gauze post-op day 1 by removing secondary dressing
Site: SKIN GRAFT Donor Site(s), Dressing type: Transparent film
for 5 days. Keep flap elevated when up
Active patient warming in warm room up to 27 to 30 degC
Active patient warming over bed heater (not just over flap)
Air driven temperature management blanket over patient
Inpatient Nurse to initiate the Surgeon Post Operative (Floor) phase of this plan
q1h for 2 hour, then q4h for 24 hour, then q6h for 24 hour, post-op day 1, then q8h for 24 hour, post-op day 2, then q12h for 24 hour, post-op day 3, then qdaily until discharge
on arrival to unit, then q4h for 48 hour, then q8h for 48 hour, then q12h for 24 hour, then qdaily until discharge
q1h for 2 hour, then  q4h for 24 hour, then q6h for 24 hours, post-op day 1, then q8h for 24 hours, post-op day 2, then q12h for 24 hours, post-op day 3, then qdaily until discharge
on arrival to unit, then  q4h for 48 hour, then q8h for 48 hours, then q12h for 24 hour, then qdaily until discharge
q6h, notify provider if urinary output less than 0.5 mL/kg/h for 2 hour
Review the most current diet order for therapeutic requirements, food texture and fluid thickness. Add anything to be carried forward to the new Diet Order
Except for Medications, 24 hour, with sips of water
Start: NPO, for 24 hours, Caffeine/Xanthine Free
order rate: 100 mL/h, IV, drug form: bag
order rate: 75 mL/h, IV, drug form: bag

81 mg, PO, qdaily with food, order duration: 30 day, drug form: tab-EC
Blood, AM Draw, Collection: T+1;0330, once
Blood, AM Draw, Collection: T+1;0330, once
Blood, AM Draw, Collection: T+1;0330, once

Consider consultation with Anesthesiology, Psychiatry and Complex Pain and Addiction Service  All physician to physician consults require a phone call
